title: Venezuela Braces for Economic Collapse From U.S. Blockade
summary: Venezuela could lose the bulk of its oil export revenues this year if the U.S. blockade stays in place, according to internal government estimates, a scenario that would set off a humanitarian crisis.

title: Stephen Miller Asserts U.S. Has Right to Take Greenland
summary: In a CNN interview, the Trump aide also echoed the president’s intent to run Venezuela as he laid out a case for the United States to control weaker states by flexing its military might.

title: Why Trump Refused to Back Venezuela’s Machado: Fears of Chaos, and Fraying Ties
summary: U.S. intelligence suggested María Corina Machado, Venezuela’s opposition leader, would struggle to lead the government. But her relationship with Trump officials had been souring for months.

title: U.S. Faces Uproar Over Venezuela Attack, and Kennedy Scales Back Childhood Vaccine Recommendations
summary: Plus, Marjorie Taylor Greene’s last day.

title: For Many Jan. 6 Rioters, a Pardon From Trump Wasn’t Enough
summary: Some pardoned rioters have been rearrested. Others returned to poverty and mental health challenges. And many became consumed by resentment and demands for payback.

title: Tim Walz’s 17 Months in Politics Before Ending His Re-election Bid
summary: Mr. Walz drew national notice when Kamala Harris chose him as her running mate. A fraud scandal derailed his bid for re-election as Minnesota’s governor.

title: Health Dept. to Freeze $10 Billion in Funding to 5 Democratic States
summary: The funding pause could jeopardize child care and other programs that serve hundreds of thousands of households in California, Colorado, Illinois, Minnesota and New York.

title: Six Big Political Questions for 2026
summary: A wildly important midterm year is off to a chaotic start, with a raid in Venezuela, an uneasy economy and more. Here’s what we’re curious about.

title: Swiss Bar Hit by Deadly Fire Was Not Inspected for Five Years, Authorities Say
summary: Officials in Crans-Montana, the Swiss alpine resort town where a bar fire killed 40 people last week, are facing growing accusations of lax oversight.

title: Zelensky’s Assessment Darkens as Europeans Gather to Talk Peace
summary: With Russia still seen as unlikely to stop fighting, the Ukrainian leader’s tone has shifted from upbeat to cautionary.

title: Zelensky Taps Canadian Politician Chrystia Freeland as Economic Adviser
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine appointed Chrystia Freeland, a former deputy prime minister of Canada, to a role in which she would advise on postwar reconstruction.

title: RFK Jr. Scales Back the Number of Vaccines Recommended for Children
summary: Federal health officials now recommend that children be routinely inoculated against 11 diseases, not 17, citing standards in other wealthy nations.

title: What to Know About the New Childhood Vaccine Schedule
summary: The U.S. federal government slashed the number of diseases that all children are advised to be vaccinated against to 11 from 17.

title: Appeals Court Upholds Prohibition on Trump’s Medical Research Cuts
summary: The ruling on Monday upheld a lower court’s judgment in April that the Trump administration could not drastically slash funding from the National Institutes of Health.

title: Why Israel Is Divided Over How to Investigate Oct. 7 Failures
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has proposed a commission with members chosen in a way that departs from existing law.

title: Facing Challenge From Lander, Dan Goldman Prepares to Defend His Seat
summary: Mr. Goldman, a Democrat from New York City, faces a stiff primary battle that could turn on Gaza and how to fight President Trump.

title: George Conway, a Trump Foe, Changes Home and Party to Run for Congress
summary: The former conservative has moved from the Washington suburbs to Manhattan and will run for an open House seat in a heavily Democratic district.

title: Peace Is Unraveling
summary: As states disregard limits on the lawful use of force, this may be just the beginning of a slide into frequent war.

title: Trump Is the Jan. 6 President
summary: Tragically, America is still living in a political era that began on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: Stephen Colbert Doubts Trump Can Run Two Countries at Once
summary: “The Late Show” host said the president couldn’t possibly run two nations, because “he can’t even run.”

title: Nvidia Details New A.I. Chips and Autonomous Car Project With Mercedes
summary: At the CES conference, Jensen Huang, the company’s chief executive, said the more efficient and powerful chip would begin shipping later this year.

title: Steve Sheetz, Who Popularized Convenience Stores as a C.E.O., Dies at 77
summary: Sheetz, a family-owned company that started with a single convenience store in Altoona, Pa., has more than 800 locations in seven states.

title: Trump’s Post About Slain Minnesota Lawmaker Dismays Her Children
summary: The son and daughter of Melissa and Mark Hortman have asked the president to remove a social media post promoting a conspiracy theory about the assassination.
